required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of an Adventure-based Training Programme
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of an Adventure-based Training Programme in Promoting the Psychological Well-being of Primary School Children

brief_summary.textblock: This study tested the effectiveness of an adventure-based training programme in promoting the psychological well-being of primary schoolchildren. A randomised controlled trial was conducted, with 56 primary school pupils randomly assigned to the experimental group participating in the adventure-based training programme and 64 to the attention placebo control group.

primary_outcome.measure: The Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale for Children at baseline
change of The Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale for Children at 9 months from baseline
primary_outcome.description: depressive symptoms after the last intervention session

primary_outcome.measure: change of The Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale for Children at 12 months from baseline
primary_outcome.description: depressive symptoms after 3 months from the last intervention session

secondary_outcome.measure: The Chinese version of the State Anxiety Scale for Children at baseline
change of The Chinese version of the State Anxiety Scale for Children at 9 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: anxiety level after the last intervention session

secondary_outcome.measure: change of The Chinese version of the State Anxiety Scale for Children at 12 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: anxiety level after 3 months from the last intervention session

secondary_outcome.measure: The Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale at baseline
change of The Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale at 9 month from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: self-esteem after the last intervention session

secondary_outcome.measure: change of The Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale at 12 month from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: self-esteem after 3 months from the last intervention session

secondary_outcome.measure: The Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Generic at baseline
change of The Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Generic at 9 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: quality of life after the last intervention session

secondary_outcome.measure: change of The Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Generic at 12 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: quality of life after 3 months from the last intervention session

arm_group.description: The subjects had to participate an adventure-based training programme.
The subjects had to participate a placebo control programme

intervention.description: The programme consisted of five education sessions (around 75 minutes each) and a day's adventure-based training camp at the end of the academic year

Subjects in the control group were invited to attend five 75-minute sessions of leisure activities, organised by a community centre, which included a cartoon film show, handicraft workshops, a health talk on the prevention of influenza and age-appropriate physical leisure activities, such as table tennis, badminton, chess and Chinese billiards. Additionally, they were invited to join a day visit to Hong Kong Ocean Park at the end of the academic year.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hong Kong Chinese primary pupils from forms 5 and 6 of two schools were invited to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- those with a chronic illness or identified cognitive and learning problems were excluded.

overall_official.affiliation: School of Nursing, The University of Hong Kong
